content.description: Fun blocky holds out of the dike and onto the upper brown wall. Thin climbing leads to the anchors. Shares the first two clips with the Pangolin.
content.protection: 10 bolts to a two-bolt anchor. There's also an additional low bolt for the belayer to clove into if needed.
content.location: Lower Dike - Starts 30 feet up in the dike gully. Be careful belaying here!

content.description: This is the premier route at Bald Bluff and should be on every New England climber's tick list. Fantastic climbing through wild square cut basalt blocks sticking out of the wall. As the blocks dwindle the route gets harder. Rest when you can because the top is thin and pumpy! 14 bolts to an anchor. There's also a two bolt rap station at the 6th clip for those foolish enough to bring a rope shorter than 60 meters or for those looking to just do the 5.9 section through the first 5 bolts. .
content.location: Lower Dike - Begins about 15 feet up the bottom of the dike. Scramble easily up blocks to a high first bolt.

content.description: Another epic Dike Wall route envisioned and equipped by local legend Pokey Amory! Start up easy ledges for a few clips to get to the business. Multiple boulder problems with less-than-ideal rest stances get's you to the half-way mark at a juggy, undercling flake. From here the climb eases off a fair amount but plan on encountering a few more thin sections including the final moves to the anchors.
content.location: Middle Dike - Just downhill from where the trail meets the wall.

content.description: An epic journey up the left end of the Dike Wall! Tricky climbing up to and through the overhang onto the face above. Fun moves through some basalt blocks leads to endless pulls through smaller and smaller holds to a heartbreaker finish through unfairly thin crimps. 14 bolts to anchors.
content.location: Lower Dike - This is the left-most and lowest climb on the wall. It starts right next to the fixed rope that protects the scramble up to the South Wall.

content.description: Fun crimping up thin edges from bottom to top. 5 bolts to anchors.
content.location: Upper Dike - The upper most bolted climb at the cliff.

content.description: good warm up pitch for the neighboring climbs, really wish it kept on going. we'll see...5.8 climbing up until the last 3 bolts then it turns on a bit
content.location: Ten feet right of welcome to greenwood. The belayer should be good staying lower and not having to belay in the gully

content.description: An epic journey out of the dike and up to the top of the wall! Shares the first two clips with Wet Market. Climb out of the dike on fun blocky holds traversing up and right quite a bit to the ledge at the top of the dike. Rest here then make a committing move to a jug and head into the tricky crux sequence. Keep some gas in the tank for the top!
content.protection: 14 bolts to a two-bolt anchor. There's also an additional low bolt for the belayer to clove into if needed.
content.location: Last (highest) route in the chasm. Belay from a small stance inside the upper end of the chasm next to Wet Market.

content.description: Climbs straight up the smooth white face. Moderate climbing up lower angle rock leads to the 3rd bolt and steeper rock. A thin crux through the 4th clip gets you to easier but pumpy climbing on underclings and sidepulls above to a rest at a small ledge (set of anchors here). Continue on from here on mostly good holds to the very top of the cliff.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor, 2 more bolts after that for the extension to a second two bolt anchor
content.location: Middle Dike - Climbs the obvious white streak on the wall.

content.description: Climb out the center of the arch into some thin crimping. Grab a rest at a jug then head up into the big white patch for a second thin crux into slightly more moderate terrain to the top. Save a little something for the finishing moves which have a little punch!
content.location: Middle Dike - Climbs out the center of the low roof/arch and heads straight up the wall passing an obvious white patch.

content.description: Hard undercling moves leftwards gets you into a shallow, left facing corner. More tricky moves lead to a ledge and anchors. 6 bolts.
content.location: Middle Dike - Just before the big drop-off down the dike gully, look for a couple of bolts protecting an undercling flake.

content.description: A thin bouldery start right off the ground brings you to a ledge and much easier climbing to the anchors. 5 bolts to anchors.
content.location: Upper Dike - Begins at the top of the gully on a dark brown face.

content.description: Fun climbing on a variety of interesting features with a very distinct thin crux a third of the way up. 9 bolts to anchors.
content.location: Middle Dike - Starts at the right-arching overhang near where the trail meets the wall.

content.description: This is a link-up of "Spikes & Twine" and "Welcome to Greenwood City". Climb the first 12 bolts of "Spikes" then move right into the last 2 bolts of "Welcome" avoiding the thin crux of "Spikes".
content.location: Lower Dike - Move rightwards after the 12th clip into the upper section of "Welcome to Greenwood City".

content.description: This is the premier wall at Bald Bluff. 100+ feet tall and 300 feet long this wall is a stunner. Vertical to gently overhung, this wall has fantastic climbing from 5.10 to 5.12. The Dike Wall has some of the most interesting features to climb in Western Maine. Large and small chunks of basalt were left sticking out of the wall as the dike eroded leaving some truly amazing square-cut holds to grab. "Welcome to Greenwood City" and "Spikes & Twine" are the best ways to climb these features.
